title.rendered: Minecraft players: How to get the Windows 10 beta for free

content.rendered:
As announced, the Microsoft developer studio Mojang released an updated beta version for Minecraft today for the launch of Windows 10. The Windows 10 Edition Beta normally costs just under ten euros, but can also be obtained free of charge for all owners of an old version of Minecraft for PC or Mac. Anyone who is one of the more than 20 million Minecraft players worldwide and who installed the new Windows 10 OS with today’s launch can secure the right new app for the block adventure right away. It brings some functions from other operating systems to the PC. The Windows 10 Edition Beta is available completely free of charge after registering in the Mojang account and waiting a short time.
Windows 10 gets its own Minecraft

This is how you get the beta for Windows 10 for free

To do this, log into your Mojang account at account.mojang.com/login using any web browser. There you will also find the option to request the beta in your master data. All necessary steps are shown. You also need to authenticate with your Microsoft account to redeem a Windows 10 Edition Beta coupon code via Redeem. Finally, the account is then assigned a free code for downloading via the Windows Store. The code can be redeemed if you already have Windows 10 and the new store installed.
If you log on to the Mojang website briefly, with a bit of luck you will already find the opportunity to secure the free code for the free download of the Windows 10 Edition Beta.

High rush, waiting times are inevitable

Since last night, the new beta version is already being distributed among the existing Mojang account owners. The whole thing does not work automatically but only on request. Due to the large rush, there may still be waiting times. So if you can’t yet install the new app for free and don’t see the possibility in your own Mojang account, you shouldn’t despair but log out again and try again later.

What’s different about Windows 10 Edition Beta?

The app gets more options, including:

  • Play with up to seven friends in local multiplayer and over Xbox Live
  • Play online and local multiplayer with Pocket Edition players
  • Quickly switch between different input methods
  • Share game scenes thanks to built-in GameDVR
  • A special feedback mechanism is intended to help collect as many user opinions as possible.
